author: andreas.kirchner
title: Staking for Children
description:
We want families to stake their money.
Families lose in average 1000€ a year with low-interest bank accounts.
How can we support them?

f6_assessments.q0: It would be great to have a trustworthy toy for kids to teach them about managing a bank account and earning money through household chores. This proposal introduces a toy for kids and families that can be connected to a bank account and promotes financial literacy. However, since the proposing team plans to use stablecoins for their staking, the team should include how they plan to introduce Cardano to kids and families in their educational program to make it more relevant to the community and to voters.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has an up and running website that gives proof of prior work and would make the feasability for this proposal very high. However, there are some parts of the proposal, that are not quite clear. The proposal asks for the whole fund of this challenge, which would mean that no other proposal in this challenge would receive any funding. The team claims that they created a monopoly for "learn to earn" which is actually a quite common theme in crypto communities which I kind of would want a proposing team to know. The team itself has only one team member with experience in crypto and they mention pedagogic partners as well as toy companies - but they don´t give any reference for us to look this up. So if this proposal basically is about crypto and education, the relevant experience of the team does not quite match a project this large at this moment. The website itself shows a very nice and interesting product, that connects bank account information of fiat currency in a digital tool, which sounds great. The proposing team should make it clear, how it aims to provide payment options and connect staking and banking with crypto currencies through european bank accounts as this is not yet common. The most important thing that I´m missing in this proposal is "risks". Financial literacy is important and if the team is targeting families and kids, the  most important tool would be to let us as a community know, that they will be including the risks of paying with crypto as well as investing with crypto and crypto taxes. I actually think this project would be really great if it used a tool where the kids to paper trading or any other not real way of learning how to manage an account with crypto currencies and DeFi. At the moment, the website seems to focus on teaching kids how to manage fiat money and I´m guessing that the team would want to include information about crypto currencies and digital currencies. Which is great, but the proposal is somewhat lacking clarity and is missing relevant risks that should be considered. The provided roadmap is very confusing and includes additional funding rounds as well as crowdfunding.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is not easy as this is a big project with lots of steps and the roadmap and budget breakdown is confusing and includes addional funding that is not yet secured. The team did not elaborate about the risks of this project, if not enough funding is secured to build the envisioned product. The team did not include an assessment of the risks that are involved for families and obviously for kids when paying and investing in crypto. It is difficult to pin down the steps of the proposal as it is about education, creating a stakepool, onboarding new families to this brand, developing and producing a wearable for kids to spend money with and so on. It is also at this moment a developing project that focusses on fiat money - the team should provide way more information on how it plans to include and differentiate between fiat money and crypto currencies....

f6_assessments.q0:
"The idea of teaching kids to save money with cryptocurrency and using staking to get interest for the financial future of children in the family is a great one.

But when I read this proposal I see that the proposer who is looking for a 200,000ADA fund has exceeded the budget of this challenge. With the impact that the proposal brings is not too much, but it does not seem reasonable to need such a large amount of money"
f6_assessments.q1:
"I found the proposal to show the relevant experience of team members in a very general way and not specifically how many people the team has, what is the specific experience of each person.

Besides, the proposer has not shown us a specific plan for what they will use the funds for, how many families and children they aim to help and how much money the children will save. How much is through the application of the proposal.

Plus, their app is currently connecting with traditional banks. Proposal also hasn't laid out how to integrate Cardano's wallet into the app and how to encourage people to use crypto instead of fiat."
f6_assessments.q2:
"Proposal does not have a specific plan for all that the proposer writes in the proposal. We have absolutely no idea what they used that money for and how to use it to achieve what results. Therefore, it is almost impossible to audit

So, i think proposer should have a specific plan with a specific target like: amount of money children will save in this platform."

f6_assessments.q0: Definitely a unique proposal for the Cardano blockchain. Teaching kids and giving them early adoption of financial education is a privilege as previous generations lack of incentives like this during their childhood. Moreover, the proposal fits into dApps & intergration, I think. The solution given is a good way to also teach children about the innovative prospect of the digital age towards finance and its values.
f6_assessments.q1: I do believe the future of cryptocurrency will be the young pioneers of tech and given opportunities to the youths. The roadmap of the proposal is well delivered, and the website have already given confidence for voters for this proposal to move forward. Though, risks to be addressed, and management are not prepared, but the proposer have presented its detailed business model and sales strategy for this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is complete and solid enough to understand what the vision is, along with the overview of how the finny app works from the video attached. Budget allocation is well planned and key metrics and milestones for the proposal are clear. Therefore, I think it does add value to the current diverse community of Cardano.

solution: Cardano is PoS. With stablecoins & staking rewards, let's offer an incentive to save money. Let families w. children make 1st steps in DeFi.
experience:
We are a Financial Literacy startup w. 3k users
We have pedagogic partners to develop a solution
1 Co-founder has know-how in Crypto
